materials.raw_text: B: 600 g of B6, Co: 200 g of Cobalt powder, Pa: 10 g of Palladium powder, V: 400 g of Vanadium powder

sourcing.instructions: B6: Specialty chemical suppliers, Co: Metal powder suppliers or online marketplaces, Pa: Precious metal suppliers, V: Metal powder suppliers
steps: B6: Specialty chemical suppliers, Co: Metal powder suppliers or online marketplaces, Pa: Precious metal suppliers, V: Metal powder suppliers

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely. 2. In a clean mixing container, combine 600 g of B6, 200 g of cobalt powder, 10 g of palladium powder, and 400 g of vanadium powder. 3. Use a mechanical mixer or mortar and pestle to ensure uniform distribution of all powders for about 10 minutes. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable mold for the desired dimensions (3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches).

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 2. Once the furnace reaches the desired temperature, place the mold inside. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and bonding of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 2. Once the furnace reaches the desired temperature, place the mold inside. 3. Maintain this temperature for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and bonding of the materials.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature, which may take approximately 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool naturally to room temperature, which may take approximately 4-6 hours. 2. Do not open the furnace door until it has cooled to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the solid sample from the mold. 2. Use a fine-grit sandpaper to smooth the edges and surfaces of the sample. 3. If necessary, apply a sealant to enhance surface durability and prevent oxidation. Allow the sealant to cure according to the manufacturer's instructions.
